snippet.title: Duke Nukem: Time to Kill (PS1) Gameplay
snippet.description:
This it just the first fifteen minutes of gameplay in Duke Nukem: Time to kill on the PS1 as played on a PS2 with texture smoothing on.

Dubbed "Duke Raider," Time to Kill took Duke in a new direction. Though I still say that Duke is best enjoyed as a First Person Shooter, I've still always like Time to Kill. There is definitely an obvious Tomb Raider influence, but there is a lot more action in the game as well. 

Some of the jumping mechanics may not work aw well at TR's do, but overall, it's still a well designed game mixed with TR inspired level designs, more action, and Duke's wisecracks. 

There is even a two-player split screen deathmatch mode, which is fun from what I remember of playing it, but, being only two players, it's appeal it limited at best.

The game's intro also shows the humor in the game very well, but seeing as it contains a Stabbing Westward song it it, I won't be showing it on my channel, because I know the copyright hounds will be unleashed.
